
A new map of Arabia divided into its several regions and districts. From Monsr. d'Anville, Geographer to the most Christian King with additions and improvements from Mr. Niebuhr. London, Published by Laurie & Whittle, 53 Fleet Street, as the act directs 12th May, 1794.  

https://www.davidrumsey.com/luna/servlet/detail/RUMSEY~8~1~31563~1150042:A-new-map-of-Arabia-divided-into-it

Was located in Allegheny College, in the same state where JS lived during the Book of Mormon translation. See discussion [here](https://www.fairmormon.org/answers/Question:_Did_Joseph_Smith_have_access_to_materials_related_to_Nahom_at_Allegheny_College%3F)

---

https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Accuratissima_et_Maxima_Totius_Turcici_Imperii_Tabula.jpg

Accuratissima_et_Maxima_Totius_Turcici_Imperii_Tabula.jpg

English: A map of Turkish possessions including Egypt and Greece by Justus Danckerts (1635-1701) shows the Arabian peninsula in the center. A decorative cartouche adorned with several costumed figures, a pyramid, and lions. Amsterdam. 52 x 62cm.

Notice 'Olim' right in the middle.  By it is "Meschel Ocem" which may have subconciously provided the 'sh' sound to produce "Oli_she_m".
